alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 08 at 7:54AM PST until November 08 at 1:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, San Bernardino. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 754 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.75 to 1.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Bernardino, Hesperia, Lake Arrowhead, Running Springs, Rimforest, Skyforest, Hwy 18 Between Running Springs And Skyforest, Hwy 173 Between Lake Arrowhead And Hesperia, Crestline and Hiwy 330 Between San Bernardino And Running Springs. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
